poem:
Title: "The Cursive Cry of the Careworn Earth"

Khan, in his court of cosmic concern,
Bids the inkwell of justice to churn.
A cadre of scribes, in academic garb,
Unravel impunity's gnarled arabesque.
Cry not in whispers, but roar for respite,
Club the gavel for verdant verity's light.
Against wounds of the world, take a stand,
Khan, hold the healing in your hand.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
